Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Nights”
Reviews.Author: Noorihan
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Villa Laguna from 31 March to 3 April 2012. After 13 hours of flight and 5 hours stopover in Dubai, we dread the thought of having to drag our luggages to the hotel. But as we exit the Lido waterbus station, about 80 metres away on the right , to our great relief was Villa Laguna. Check in was fast, we we shown to our room, it met our expectations. We didn't book the the kitchenette, but since there was no coffee / tea making facilities in the room, we paid 60 Euros extra and the kitchenette was available for our use ( useful for making coffee/tea, instant noodles etc.) As reviewed by other guests, the view from the breakfast room was magnificient! The breakfast menu was more than adequate for us. The frontdesk staff was helpful and was always willing to answer questions / give directions. I would've given a 5***** rating if there was free wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Hard beds...musty smell...$$$”
Reviews.Author: TravelBunny91
Reviews.Content: We did book the family suite last minute so if we had paid less we may have been more pleased. 200 Euros per night. Beds and pillows so hard my kids complained. I am use to the comforts of W Hotels so keep that in mind. I had to hold the on button on the dryer to keep it running. The suite had a kitchen that would cost another 60 Euros per day to use internet 30 Euros per day. However, the room was a one bedroom with living area/kitchenette and had ample room for a family of four. Very clean. The location was ideal because Lido is quiet and quaint compared to the hustle and bustle of the St Marco area. The water taxi was efficient and pleasant to get you to whatever you wanted to do. Mixed front desk customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem of a hotel with a fantastic view over to San Marco”
Reviews.Author: ritrth
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels over the years and what we find draws us back to hotels/places are exceptional views and that is exactly what the Villa Laguna and the front facing rooms and restaurant offer. When you are sitting in the restaurant you feel as if you are able to touch the water. We only had the continental breakfast which was more than adequate so cannot comment on the hotel food in general. The Lido has few restaurants so can be limiting if you are looking for variety; may be best to eat in Venice before making the journey home across the water, although most of the meals we had on the Lido were good value for money. Don't miss the sunsets! The rooms are suites and are really clean and inviting although the bed for us was somewhat on the hard side! We do have to say that the staff were really polite, helpful and knowledgeable. The waterbus is virtually next door and the journey to San Marco is around 10 to 15 minutes but we felt this was part of the holiday. Some of the waterbuses have outside seats both front and back, take advantage of these in order to see the stunning views; you will need to be first in line! The No.1 takes you up the grande canal. You will need to get a water pass as this is much cheaper than paying for single trips; cheaper to buy online 7 days in advance of your trip. TIps: if you are going to the Doges Palace you need cash as they do not take credit cards. Also, don't bother with a gondala 70-80 euros for 15 minutes; a complete and utter rip off - treat yourself to a nice meal. If you don't want to pay 4 euros for a cup of coffee, look for the lovely cafes that do take out (the menu will list both sit in and take out prices). Some only have tall tables (no chairs) where you can have a good cup of coffee for 2 euro - ok no view, but 2 minutes later you can sit on the canal side and watch the gondalos coming and going at no extra cost!

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel overlooking venice”
Reviews.Author: Rumb
Reviews.Content: I have just rebooked this hotel for the third year in a row, it is one of the highlights of my year. The views are truly outstanding from the magnificent restaurant / breakfast room on the lido. The rooms are well furnished in true Venetian style, with great Occitane products in the bathroom. The staff are very helpful, knowledgable and Flexible, as well as being friendly great balance, perfect professionalism. The cocktails in the garden really hit the spot. Great, great location 1 minute walk from the water bus and Alilaguna airport link. 15 minutes from the hustle and bustle of touristy Venice centre.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, outside of the city yet conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Marilynn76
Reviews.Content: This was not only our first time in Italy, but our first night in Italy, so I didn't know what to expect - and the Hotel Villa Laguna exceeded my expectations. We arrived on a rainy late October evening in total darkness on the Alilaguna ferry from the airport. The hotel was only steps away from the ferry dock and the lobby was bright and welcoming. Just turn right as you exit the ferry terminal and walk for a few minutes along the sidewalk, and you can't miss it. The front desk staff were all extremely friendly during our 3-night stay and went out of their way to answer our questions and show us maps, etc. One man even made a phone call to San Servolo for me to check opening times and tour information. When we came downstairs the first morning and walked into the breakfast room I was stunned. There was no one else there and the room was absolutely beautiful. The whole one wall is windows with a breathtaking view of the lagoon and Venice in the distance. The breakfast itself is very good with a wide selection of beverages and food. There was fresh fruit, cereal, all kinds of breads and pastries, yogurt, ham and cheese, and fresh fruit juices, still and sparkling water, and tea and coffee. Venice is about a 15-minute boat ride away. It pays to get the ACTV vaporetto pass from the airport. You can get them in various time increments (I think we did 36 hours). The pass is good for all of the ACTV public vaporetti (Venice's public water bus system), which includes the boat from Lido to Venice. We never had to worry about buying individual vaporetto tickets; it was literally hop-on, hop-off the whole three days. I think we booked the cheapest room. We were on the street side and the room was very small, but that wasn't a problem for me. There was a TV but we didn't use it. There was a fridge which actually had some space for us to put our own drinks in. The bathroom was fine and everything functioned well, and I thought the toiletries provided were really nice. The one problem that I had was that the street was VERY noisy. Usually I don't have any problems with street noise but this was beyond anything I've ever encountered. It sounded like there were trucks going past all night long. There are many restaurants and cafes (mostly pizzerias) within walking distance from the hotel. They mostly seem to be located on the main street that goes straight out from the ferry terminal, the Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta. I would most definitely stay at the Villa Laguna again. The service, friendliness, convenience and beauty were top-notch. The only thing I would do different next time is book a seaside room.

Reviews.Title: “Great view over the piazza San Marco”
Reviews.Author: PatrickChatou
Reviews.Content: The breakfast in this hotel was a great experience, great view over the laguna and San Marco

Reviews.Title: “Another delightful stay at Villa Laguna..”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage30
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times and this past summer had another delightful stay. The views from the hotel of the Venice skyline are stunning. Antonio, the Manager and his capable staff make sure that each guest feels as if this is their"home away from home." The rooms are tastefully decorated and always clean with l"Occitane toiletries provided so that unpacking ones's own isn't even necessary. The breakfast buffet is more than ample with quality goods. The bar and restaurant offer service with that fabulous lagoon view. Ulike some other hotels what you see in their terrific web site photos is truly what you get. Grazie tutte !!

Reviews.Title: “keep away!!!”
Reviews.Author: solby
Reviews.Content: I want this hotel all to myself, Having stayed many times the new owners have made it even better now. Great rooms, Super position, Super breakfast, Helpful staff. Love being on the Lido after a days sightseeing very convenient and easy to travel around. Plenty of eating places on the Lido to chill out in the evenings. Dinner on the hotel terrace is also a wonderful experience. So stay away....so theres more room for me!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and professional operation”
Reviews.Author: KMCA456
Reviews.Content: Very close to Lido terminus; all rooms suites, many with lagoon view. Pleasant restaurant with superb view.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel on Lido”
Reviews.Author: amysanford
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Venice the night of the one day transit strike so getting to Lido was a little tricky. IF there are no strikes happening then the water buses run regular to Lido and is an easy transit. This hotel has was very cute and right on the water. It is also VERY conveniently located close to the water bus station. The room we were in was very spacious, we actually decided to book an extra night because we enjoyed it so much. The staff were very nice and the hotel was very clean. We ate only the standard breakfast in the hotel, which was nice, but did not have dinner. The hotel offered for us to take a 'factory tour' of a glass factory on Murano, it was nice but not much of a tour as it is more of a trip to a very expensive glass showroom. But the island of Murano was nice and there are cheaper stores along the canal. I can see this as a GREAT alternative to staying in the main parts of Venice. It was quiet and no large tourist groups or mobs of people about. I would stay here again if (and when) I return to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: D W
Reviews.Content: Right next to water bus, Lido station. We purchased 3 day pass for the water bus to go into Venice as needed. Hotel staffs are excellent, friendly, and very helpful. Staying at this hotel makes us feel like we are really on vacation, on the island! A nice 10 minute walk takes you to Lido Beach. It is a sand beach where locals hang out. This hotel takes you away from all the noises and crowd of Venice, and yet you are only 15 minutes away by boat.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to revisit!”
Reviews.Author: Julie K
Reviews.Content: Let's start with two small niggles, both of which are not the hotel's fault. Firstly we booked a triple room via a booking site and assumed that would give us 3 beds but we had a double plus sofa bed. So always double check. We had the double made into twins and the sofa bed was very comfy!! Second we had a road side room and the traffic was quite noisy so take ear plugs or treat yourself to Lagoon side room-we will next time. Now onto plus points-location is amazing on the Lido looking across to St.Marks and gloorious sunsets! It is a one minute walk to catch the waterbus to hope across the lagoon. Rooms are nicely fitted out and the public areas are lovely too, in particular the gardens. The staff are lovely with a special thank you to Fabio and Gennaro. Nearby is the amazing beach and lots of shops and restaurants-try Pizzeria Stella-fab!! All in all an excellent choice when visiting Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small, quiet and convenient hotel. Couldn't be better.”
Reviews.Author: travelbuff88
Reviews.Content: So convenient...very close to everything on Lido Island....water taxi, shopping, restaurants you name it. Rooms very comfortable & clean. The hotel was full but would have never known it as it was so quite. Great place to stay while visiting Venice...just a quick 5-10 min water taxi ride to St. Mark's Square. Our room was right on the water and had a wonderful view of Venice/St Mark's Square...especially at night....beautiful. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: Orient_Ex_Travel
Reviews.Content: Venice was the last stop of our 6 day journey on the Orient Express. We settle in for 3 nights at the Villa Laguna on Lido island. While it is not in the heart of Venice proper we found staying in a hotel away from the crowds in & around San Marco Square had a lot of advantages. Our suite was on the first floor looking out over the lagoon and San Marco Square in the distance and had a small garden in which we could sit. The 2 room suite we had was spacious & comfortable. The service and staff in the hotel were friendly & competent and were able to help us with several of our needs...like finding an adapter I could use to re-charge my computer. The breakfast was more than just a roll & coffee. The public water transportation was only a block away so all of Venice & the surrounding islands were easily accessible. The restuarants on Lido were great. We had a wonderful time and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best views but very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: joconnel
Reviews.Content: This property was on the Island of Lido overlooking the Grand Canal. It is the last stop by Vaporetto from the Train station and the ride took just over an hour from the station but was not too bad. The hotel itself was very lovely and updated but the rooms were very small. We had a suite room and the pull out couch for our daughter was not very comfortable. The bathroom was very small and I had to duck in the shower as there was a large wooden beam that ran through the shower(I am 6 fett tall). I will have to say that the island itself was quite lovely we walked 10 minutes to a beach and were able to put our feet in the Adriatic Sea. There were some nice shops and it was very convenient to a laundromat for those who may be packing lightly. Overall this was our least favorite hotel out of our four stops in Amalfi, Rome, Florence and Venice. The location was great and if the rooms were a little larger I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Very Best - Again!”
Reviews.Author: ColdCanary
Reviews.Content: Our return to Villa Laguna was full of expectations from last year, and it was excellent this time too. A family of four enjoyed the perfect location, the short walk to the beach, great food, and perfection in service all over the house etc. Very friendly staff. Room with garden and lagoon view is a winner for all of us. We will be back many times - we have not had a better stay anywhere in Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, attention, food .. all positive!”
Reviews.Author: Olaerts
Reviews.Content: We stayed with a group of 15 from which 8 children between 3 and 12. The rooms were spacious, clean and the large fridge came handy for stocking bottles of water. 2 minutes walking away there is a nice supermarket as well. We had twice dinner and the food was excellent as well as the service. The setting is very nice and the children loved to watch the cruises coming in every morning. I have not heard any complaint from any of the party! Fully recommendable! This is a small hotel with personal service!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: secarte2
Reviews.Content: If you could somehow pick up this hotel and put it on Venice proper, I would give it 5 stars. But considering it was cheaper than anything on Venice itself, even some of the scary looking places, it's worth the time on the boat to get there and back every day. Our room was really pretty and one of the biggest we had while in Italy, and we had a great view looking over the lagoon. Breakfast was good, and we ate dinner in the restaurant one night. It was maybe a little overpriced, but you can't beat the convenience on a night when you're too tired to search, and it was all tasty. The boat stop is literally right outside the door, so don't worry about not finding it when you get to Lido. It takes about 15 minutes to get to the stop at St. Mark's Basilica. The staff was really nice and they watched our bags on the last day after we checked out. When we go back to Venice, unless we're super-rich and can stay somewhere just as nice on Venice itself, I will definitely stay at Villa Laguna again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room and view, but a bit pricey...”
Reviews.Author: AndyWilliamson22
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Villa Laguna for 3 nights in July and, having come from Florence in a room without air conditioning, the room at the Villa Laguna was like a dream! It was lovely and cool, with a separate bedroom and front room and a great view towards St Marks Square (which looked amazing at sunset). The reception guy on arrival, Fabio, was also extremely helpful as was the other chap on reception we encountered. We loved Venice, and the hotel was in a perfect location as it was only a minute's walk away from the Water Bus which took us wherever we wanted to go. The only downside was cost. While the hotel was pricey to start with, this was to be expected as the whole of Venice was a bit pricey. However, what was a bit frustrating was the added extras - my girlfriend got charged for a full three course set meal in the restaurant, for example, despite having only two courses from the a la carte menu. And paying 5 Euros for wi-fi in the rooms which was supposed to last an hour but actually only lasted 45 minutes (twice). When you pay for a hotel like this, I think it would go a long way for little extras such as the above to be free. And the charge to watch the redentore fireworks on the Saturday night over dinner was 140 Euros! Extortionate, especially when we watched them for free on the main island in the end, and they were amazing!! Breakfast was decent (but nothing special) and closed earlier than the specified 10:00 time on one of the three days. However, this was a lovely hotel (particularly the rooms) and a fantastic location. On that basis alone, I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Sunsets and all that jazz”
Reviews.Author: Robin_Saikia
Reviews.Content: Jazz and sunset is a combination well worth trying. Normally one associates jazz with smoky all-night clubs in basements: finger-tapping beardies, superannuated swing pianists with nicotine-stained fingers, the clump of the bass, the plaintive scream of the horn, the unexampled hangover. A rather more upllifting experience awaits at the Ristorante Villa Laguna, part of the well reviewed hotel of that name on the Lido, very near to the vaporetto station. There is live jazz two or three times a week at the Laguna. It makes for a pleasant evening, since the restaurant overlooks the lagoon in the direction of San Marco and the view at sundet is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, relaxing, and reasonable for Venice”
Reviews.Author: SusanfromHollis
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel via this sight and booked due to positive reviews...it could not have gone better. Quiet location, great views of St Mark's Square, with the vaporetto stop to Venice literally next door. Lots of choice for breakfast and a nice place to have dinner also, if a bit pricey...but so is most of Venice. Highly recommend this place if you'd like a nice retreat at the end of a busy day of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: poozie81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights from 20/06/11 for my birthday and were treated to the only room with a balcony over looking Venice. The suite was nicely decorated and clean, lovely bathroom treats and sky so we could keep up with Wimbledon! Reception staff were welcoming and professional and were able to organise free transport to Murano. The breakfast was simple; croissant, toast, yoghurt, cheese and meats etc. Not our idea of "holiday" breakfast but it did the job. There was a very angry little man attempting to wait on at breakfast on our first morning, but thankfully we didn't see him again. The hotel should consider keeping him back of house from now on! The hotel is situated immediately to the right of the water bus station so is perfect for "popping over" to Venice, it literally takes 10 minutes to reach the tourist attractions and they run until late. I would highly recommend staying on Lido rather than in Venice. After a day sightseeing in Venice, I was desparate to get back to cool, calm Lido. Being on Lido encouraged us to explore more of the islands and make use of our water bus tickets. Venice can be easily done in a day and after that the constant crowds start to grate a little. I have already recommended this hotel to good friends and just hope they have as good a stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Away from the madding crowds”
Reviews.Author: journeymancannes
Reviews.Content: The hotel has the most beautiful views across the lagoon to Venice. Taking a car across to the Lido can be a lengthy process, given the queues to get across in summer...and it's also VERY expensive...â‚¬75 return! Maybe better to park back at the end of the causeway and get a vaporetto, though remember all this romantic sloshing about in boats takes TIME and more money! If you DO take the car, there is not even a space to pull up outside the hotel and the parking it offers is a 20 minute walk away and costs extra. If you don't pay cash they charge you more, which is silly and mean for an outfit of this standard. The staff -especially Fabio- are very helpful and friendly and the hotel is well appointed though our suite was split into two by a corridor, making both rooms feel small, and the view from one window was totally blocked by a palm tree! We were surprised only to have a shower in a room costing almost â‚¬200 a night and it was underpowered and rarely hot. Breakfast was fine and the setting outside for dinner was delightful, with excellent food. We had to leave a day early but there was no question of us not having to pay the for the "lost" night, not even a discount. Overall, a peaceful haven away from the madness of Venice in summer but still trying to make up my mind as to whether it is good value, or just a little bit cheeky price-wise.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: baldrust
Reviews.Content: Villa Laguna is as beautiful as the photographs! The staff is exceptional, the rooms are lovely, and the outdoor garden with a view of Saint Mark's Square is excellent! The restaurant for dinner is excellent as well.... delicious food! While it takes a little longer to reach on the water bus, it really only adds about 10 minutes to the ride up the Grand Canal and it is definitely worth coming back to the Villa Laguna after a long day in Venice. Our only comment is regarding the shower, our room was on the third floor and while the bathroom was spacious for Italy and very beautiful, we were four tall individuals and the shower was built into the slope of the roof line and had wooden beams on the ceiling making it difficult to stand up straight in the shower. The tub is a jacuzzi tub and quite delightful after a long day though! Also, while the pillows were plentiful they could have been a little "fluffier", they were rather flat...the beds though were comfortable enough! Very much enjoyed our stay and would stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located escape!”
Reviews.Author: thegucc
Reviews.Content: What a place to stay to get away from the throngs of tourists in the core while being as close as possible to the 10 min fry to get there. Great location with cool modern lounge style outdoor furniture overlooking fabulous sunsets over San Marco. Everything is reasonably priced (rooms, food, bar drinks that come with snacks). Views are free. Extra space (compared to central Venice) is free. Rooms are super clean and renovated. Great bathtub/shower with l'occitain bath products. I also find Lido underrated. Great local vibe... Families, bars, Villas, etc. You don't even need to come here for the beach... The hotel alone is worth the trip. This is my 4th trip to Venice (first with kids). I would definatkey stay here Again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! And away from the crowds...”
Reviews.Author: MichaelAdy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Villa Laguna rather than staying in Venice proper. What a great decision. While Venice is truly something to see, the crowds can be a bit like Disneyland in July -- shoulder-to-shoulder. Villa Laguna is on the island of Lido, which has spectacular views of Venice. The vaparetto station is very close (maybe 50 yards?), so getting to and from the other islands is very easy, plus the public beach on the Adratic Sea is only a ten or fifteen minute walk from the hotel. The hotel staff were probably the best part about the hotel -- attentive, nice, helpful (especially the bar staff!). There was live music in the outside part of the restaurant on the weekend, which was an unexpected but nice way to relax after a day of getting purposely lost in the streets of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, great location, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: NikkiandDoug
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night at the Villa Laguna but we would certainly come back. We received a very warm welcome and were shown to our suite - what a lovely surprise to find that the hotel's rooms are almost all suites! The garden looks out across the Lagoon towards Venice and is a perfect spot for an aperitivo. We found travelling to and from the main island very easy and enjoyed the quiet of the Lido after a day among the tourists! Wonderful location, great rooms, delicious breakfast and fantastic service. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “First time visiting the Lido and this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DriverCheshire
Reviews.Content: Having visited Venice on a number of occeasions we decided to stay on the Lido this year and fortunately booked this hotel, we arrived in style by private transfer from the airport an expensive but very enjoyable way to arrive. Excellent aspect with well maintained gardens overlooking the lagoon and very close to the terminal for water taxis. Breakfast was provided in the conservatory overlooking the lagoon with plenty of choice and good service, evening meal was good though as you would expect expensive. we had booked a lagoon veiow room prior to arrival and check in was faultless and our room had a lovely beamed ceiling with separate living area. Quiete location, with attentive staff who made our stya all the more enjoyable, you can book here with confidence of a quality stay at reasonabe prices (FOR Venice!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Great Location in Lido. Wonderful view.”
Reviews.Author: Sobotta67
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, service is good, location next to station is the best and the view from the front rooms is breathtaking. Carlo and Massimo at front desk were very helpful doing everything from showing me the details of the room personally upon arrival to translating a small letter into Italian for me. The breakfast buffet is good, but it could be better (and more staffed) to reach the level of other aspects of the hotel. I travel a lot and no other bedroom and bed had ever made me feel in my own bedroom and bed like this did.

Reviews.Title: “A nice and unexpected discovery”
Reviews.Author: rinaldino
Reviews.Content: At the Venice Lido I have, since several years, a flat where I am used to spend some weekends and short vacations. Therefore, knowing very well the resort, I feel entitled to state that, probably because of its proximity to the city, restaurants are a lot but almost all are either tourist-traps or restaurants of de luxe hotels, good but extremely expensive. That's why I cannot say anything about the hotel Villa Laguna where obviously I have not stayed, but I can say that I have tried its restaurant which has been a pleasant surprise. The location is absolutely unique, with a magnificent view over the lagoon and the city of Venice, not only in summer when, on the terrace,you can have dinner after a drink sitting in very comfortable armchairs, but also during the winter. The menu is not particularly large, but includes some typical Venetian dishes and some international dishes, plentiful and well prepared. The service is excellent: very professional,quick and thoughtful. But the main surprise is at the end: a bill absolutely fair and unexpected, above all considering that Venice is supposed to be the most expensiove Italian city. In conclusion, during my last wekend at the Venice Lido, I have had dinner at this restaurant for all the three evenings, always to my great satisfaction. Just to complete my account, I have to add a minor, unfavourable remark, for which the management is to blame only in part: I acknowledge that the Venice Lido is a resort and that the Villa Laguna is not a de luxe hotel, but even foreigners should know that Venice is not in Africa and that the restaurant guests ( mainly the male ones ) should avoid coming for dinner wearing shorts and barefoot sandals which, at least as far as I am concerned, spoil the beauty of the place.

Reviews.Title: “You'll be delighted with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonvoyage30
Reviews.Content: The view from this hotel is magnificent with the skyline of historical Venice a short vaparetto ride away. You can sit on the terrace with a prosecco in hand,hearing the water lap and watching the gorgeous Venetian sunset. A few years ago new management took over this boutique historical property and under the terrific leadership of Manager Antonio, the hotel has flourished. Antonio is highly service and detail orineted and it shows. Its well maintained and the decor is delightful. ( He even ensures L'Occitane toileteries are provided). The front desk team includes the bright,energetic and personable Tiziana, the very capable Fabio and the gentle and helpful Carlos. This hotel is a solid value and offers more features than some other more expensive hotels.If you want a delightful oasis on the Lido, this is your spot !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: Skjeggis
Reviews.Content: After read recommendations here at TA, we booked 5 nights at Villa Laguna. Arrived late to a fantastic scenery at their private pier. Really nice and various breakfast selection served by very kind, serviceminded staff! Either You eat inside or outside at the"breathtaking" terrace, you will start Your Venice adventure well feeded and with all needed advices from Villa Laguna staff! We stayed at room 212 which is not towards the Lagoon (so no stunning view from room), but it had big balcony and the room is really big (except the bathroom...). Lido at a alternative to Venice centre was a very good choice for us! Very easy and pretty quick to go to centre with waterbus, but also Lido is a nice place to walk or cycle around. Long nice beach as well!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL AND FANTASTIC STAFF”
Reviews.Author: PIPELINER3232
Reviews.Content: We drove to Venice and that is the only way to do it----take the ferry to Lido and you can park where you live---no dragging your suitcase a mile to some hotel in Venice.---The ferry ride is only a few minutes back from Lido to Venice and it is just so convenient. We loved the Hotel and totally love the People that were so friendly and so helpful in every way!!!!!!!! The best place to set in the evening to watch the sunset outside at the lounge bar---fantastic is all I can say about the Villa Laguna

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: phil123789
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night as part of our honeymoon in northern Italy. Overall, very good. we were perhaps a little bit concerned that we should have booked a hotel on the central island, but this hotel's location is fantastic. We had a view of the lagoon and the hotel is only 2 mins walk from the Lido water bus stop, which means it is very convenient for getting anywhere in Venice. It is a relaxing place to come back to at the end of the day and for the same money much better than anything you could get close to the grand canal. All rooms seem to be suites. Helpful and friendly staff. They provided a free one way water taxi to Murano which is worth taking advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “definitely one to recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Purnima8
Reviews.Content: we loved villa laguna - having a walking disability, i was worried about finding a hotel close to st. mark's square where the water bus would not be far from the hotel as well as water taxi etc - basically to minimize my walking. by chance, i happened to come across villa laguna, and apart from the rave reviews i found people talking about how quiet it was (all reviews of hotels in the st. mark's square area complained of the noise levels), the convenience of being away and yet 10 mins away from venice - all attracted me. and the hotel lived upto its expectations. glorious views especialy at sunset from the room, a minute away from the vaporetti stop, private water taxi mooring, fantastic staff, lovely rooms, the best coffee as compared to all the hotels that we had our sojourn, lovely restaurants and cafes a few minutes away and so much more. i would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone! tiziana, fabio and carlo - cheers to you!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: saraburrows
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our Honeymoon. We have been to Venice before for a short break and stayed somewhere different but we wanted to return for our honeymoon. we loved our stay, Our room was lovely and we had a fab view over the lagoon. Unfortunately both myself and my husband found the bed to be to hard for our personal taste/requirements. but this didnt detract from our overall stay. The weather was fantastic and got a few days on the beach too... its position near to the vaporette stop is ideal. The gardens are wonderful to sit in and relax, watching the sun set.... The staff are great, friendly and very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: HappytrailsModesto
Reviews.Content: I researched weeks on where we would stay when we were in Venice and it definitely paid off. This hotel, service and location was perfect. When I return to Venice I will not even venture out and try something else. The staff was helpful even before we arrived in making suggestions and sending information to make our trip organized so we could enjoy Venice. Once we got there the hotel was beautiful and the wonderful service just continued.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Lynnq1
Reviews.Content: I'm a bit reluctant to let everyone know how much we enjoyed our stay at Villa Laguna. I stayed with my daughter in a ground floor suite. We had twin beds, a separate lounge, kitchenette (which we didn't use, but did use the fridge to keep our wine cold), jacuzzi bath and doors leading onto our own little garden. Literally a minute walk from the waterbus and no noise was ever noticed from this. We also got the airport waterbus from here, so it was really easy on arrival and on leaving. Loved the view of St. Marks and loved sitting in our private garden with a glass of wine whilst watching the sun go down. A quick waterbus ride to Venice which ran very frequently and runs right through the night (although not as frequently), so no worries about rushing to get the last bus home. The hotel staff were friendly and hard working. You never saw anyone standing around. The cleaners really did a fantastic job. Our suite was spotless. I had been worried about staying on the Lido and not being in the centre of everything, but I can honestly say it was the right choice for us. I would recommend Villa Laguna to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: RenassainceGuy
Reviews.Content: Get there easily from airport on Alilaguna line - then get pass (for one or more days) for vaporetto near hotel and cruise everywhere you want.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Why stay in the hustle and bustle of Venice? Villa Laguna is the perfect escape!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha26
Reviews.Content: The Villa Laguna was everything it promised to be. The hotel is situated about 30m from the Vaperetto station (no noise) which was amazingly convenient for the airport water bus and transport in general. The hotel looks a little disappointing from the outside but wow! One inside we were very, very happy. The decor is tasteful and the furnishings are beautiful! The staff were fabulous and very knowledgable and helpful. The hotel is a 10 minute vaperetto (waterbus) ride away from St Marks Square but the journey there is wonderfull. The hotel bedroom was spacious, with a little lounge area, there was a kitchenette area but we did not need this. The room looked out across the lagoon separating Lido from Venice and the views from the hotel were spectacular. The rooms were spotless and I'm sure our bed was chaged every other day. Villa Laguna have high standards for cleanliness, ones we appreciated very much. Breakfast was continental, yet filling. It catered for the European market but we found we had plenty to eat before heading into the gorgeous city of Venice each morning! We chose Villa Laguna due to all the fantastic reviews on Trip Advisor and we were not disappointed, we've been recommending the hotel to family and friends since we got home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location and a super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rnickr
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to spend 4 days at Villa Laguna with friends recently. My wife and I had a small suite which was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The best thing though was the view from our windows which looked strainght over to St Marks. The terrace bar, on the shore of the Lagoon, enjoys the same view! The location was ideal. just a few yards from the Lido SME vaporetto stop, perfect for travelling around Venice while avoiding the crouds of San Marco. The staff were excellent, friendly and considerate. This may not be the cheapest place to stay but the ambiance and location make it work every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with beautiful view and excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: NikhilMohta
Reviews.Content: Villa Laguna is on the other side of the bay on Lido Island. It is a 2 min walk from the waterbus station from where one can get a waterbus to get to Venezia every 10-15 mins. It is also very close to the main street in Lido which has a lot of eateries. The Hotel is small and pretty cozy. The views from the restaurant and the breakfast room are very nice. The staff (Carlo and Tizziana) are very friendly and helpful and always willing to help. To be this was a very big positive with regard to the Hotel. The Hotel does not have a concept of room service (or didnt seem to us) so one has to go to the reception or the bar to get whatever one wants. The room we got was on the ground floor and didnt give much of a view unless one stepped out into the garden outside. Also, the room was split into the bedroom and the sitting-room, and each by themselves are pretty small. Finally, the room was next to the elevator and so there was some noise due to that (doesnt bother me as I am a deep sleeper, but might bother others).

Reviews.Title: “The Villa Laguna exceeded our expectations! View, food, service, location superb.”
Reviews.Author: kupuna11
Reviews.Content: Carlos was very helpful with handling any queries we had prior to arrival and greeted us warmly upon checkin. All of the staff and management were very kind and pleaant. The breakfast was more than we expected with a wide variety of cereals, breads and pastries, meats and cheese and the expresso was freshly made with each order. The dinner was superb. We had an absolutely wonderful lagoon suite with french windows that opend out to spectacular sunset views of San Marcos. The waterbus was only 10 minutes from the hotel. Lido is a wonderful little island with a beautiful beach on the opposite end. Recommend riding a bicycle for two around the island. It's a great way to see the island. Thank you for a wonderful stay. We recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: IckenhamChris
Reviews.Content: Villa Laguna is situated on the waters edge with wonderful views looking across the lagoon to St Marks Square. This is a lovely small hotel with great charm, we had a lovely room with a lounge area. Breakfast was an excellent continental breakfast with plenty of choice. The bar area is intimate and the garden is great for a few drinks as the sun goes down. All staff were friendly and helpful. After a day in Venice it is nice to come back to the Lido for its more relaxed style, there are plenty of good restaurants and bars and they are a little cheaper then in Venice central. We loved the hotel and plan to return

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: pigglesLondonArea
Reviews.Content: My boyfiriend and i have just returned from our trip to Venice. The Villa Laguna was a fantastic hotel, the location was perfect, right next to the waterboat stop. The staff were very friendly and happy to help, if needed. We had a room overlooking the lagoon, the views were out of this world, as we were on the ground floor we also had a little garden with table and chairs, which we weren't expecting. The rooms were a good size and very comfortable. Also there was a jacuzzi bath, which was a nice suprise. We were there for 4 nights, we bought a 72 hour pass for the boats and buses, whch we used alot, great value. The no. 1 vaporetti took us from Lido, over the Venice, it also went right up the Grand canal, that was an amazing trip in itself. Would love to go back to Venice in the future and would most certainly stay at the Villa Laguna.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Boutique Hotel Away from the Crowds”
Reviews.Author: janm74
Reviews.Content: Our room overlooked the lagoon with views toward Venice. There were 2 balconies to sit on overlooking the water to watch the boats. I loved hearing the water. The attention to detail was exceptional and our room was luxuriously appointed. The internet speed was fast. We'd spend a crowded day in Venice, then come back to a quieter place and we were able to relax. The dining room had a wonderful view of the lagoon and the food was excellent. We ate dinner there each evening and the staff learned our names and greeted us so we felt like we had personal attention. The food was fresh and delicious. We highly recommend dining here. Breakfast was much more than just croissants and coffee, which was hard to find. The patio eating area looked very inviting and also overlooked the water but it was too cool for our time of year. Carlos, at the front desk, was especially helpful giving us a map to point out ferry stops and points of interest. The ferry transport was only a 1.5 block walk. Staying at this hotel was half the fun of experiencing Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Taste, touch, see, and experience the 'Venezia' many only dream of!”
Reviews.Author: rEvans_10
Reviews.Content: The great thing about Lido is how close it is to the best of Venice plus access to the beach and seaside flavor all Venetians adore and VILLA LAGUNA is perfectly located to provide this fully rounded experience of 'la Venezia bella' plus you have excellent service, quiet, lovely rooms and the subtle, attentive service of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to Villa Laguna!”
Reviews.Author: Lefty633
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in perfect location for exploring Venice. Lido is a great place to relax at the end of a hectic day, or to just spend a day riding bicycles or visiting the beach area. Proximity to boat transportation is excellent - it was easy to walk to the hotel even with large suitcases. Fabio welcomed us to Villa Laguna and did an excellent job of providing information on both the hotel and the local area. Our room was very clean, with a wonderful view of the lagoon. We look forward to staying here again, and will recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tazzalou
Reviews.Content: Hotel is ideally located near to the water bus stops and the main street in Lido. The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. We had an upgraded room which we paid extra for and this gave us a small balcony with nice views over to St Marks Square. The bedroom was large, clean and the room also had a seperate sitting area with 2 sofas and tv. The room was lacking Tea/Coffee making facilities which any 4 star hotel should have these days. Breakfast was included however this wasn't great, we arrived for breakfast on both mornings around 0930 and there wasn't much left of anything. Very little fruit, no choice of yoguts and no choice of bread. Not good if it says breakfast is served until 1030 you would expect the food to be replenshed. The service in the breakfast room wasn't good either we had to set our own table by getting plates/cups etc from the counters as the tables hadn't been cleared and set up again from people before us. We weren't appraoched by the waiter to see if we wanted tea/coffee I had to go and ask him. Overall the hotel is of good standard and if I were to ever come to Venice again I would definitely stay here for the location rather than a hotel actually on Venice. I like reviews that tell me something helpful, so : - Go to breakfast early if you want a choice of fruit / bread etc Take a travel kettle if you want a hot drink in your room Go to the supermarket on the main street in Lido to buy your cold drinks and snacks for the day, a large bottle of iced tea was 0.69 cents rather than 2 euros for a small bottle at the kiosks. Take lots of money Venice is very expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location combined with great staff make this a prime choice.”
Reviews.Author: Seabird1
Reviews.Content: Villa Laguna exceeded our expectations. It is first class all the way. The staff is friendly and helpful. Spectacular views of Venice and right on the water. The location couldn't be better, just steps from the water taxi. The restaurant has large windows that open up right onto the water. Villa Laguna is a place we will go back to and highly recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel, great location, clean, very comfortable!!”
Reviews.Author: puffin46
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't want to be anywhere else in Venice, this hotel is in a perfect location, where we can get lots of fresh air, great view of hectic St.Marco square(which is only 10 minutes away by water bus, the station is just a minute walk from the hotel.. very convenience!!).. As we're here during the festival time, there is no space to walk on saturday, I have booked a restaurant in San Marco area, but my parents refused to walk any further because they were scare that they might caught some flu, or too much people would drive them mental or something... so we have decided to spend the rest of the day in Lido, and we have discovered some nice places to eat, yess! that includes great geloto!! In the morning we took the complimentary boat to Murano, to see the glass master at work, the boat made me feel like a superstar!! it was so beautiful! The services at Hotel Vila Laguna is so nice that this is the reason why I have actually signed up to write a review!! We had such a great time here, the room is very large, the sofa-bed I have slept in was very comfortable!!! the welcome dinner was excellent ! my dad have picked a great bottle of red wine to go with it !! I am so happy that we have picked this hotel!! would love to come back to Venice again... but maybe not at festival time!!

Reviews.Title: “small romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: azaditehran
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 night at villa laguna hotel and it was the best part of our trip to italy.the location was great .it is in lido ,quiet and lovely place and next to the water bus stop.our room over looked the sea.good break fast and very helpful staff.lady at reception vas very nice and answered our questions kindly.the hotel has romantic taste.and Im very happy i relied on reviews in trip advisor.i strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful and Quiet place away from the crowds of San Marco square”
Reviews.Author: kapnkool
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a beautiful panoramic view of Venice. Our room had a small living room attached to the bedroom. The room was spacious but the mattress was very hard. However, the view and service offset the bed shortcomings. We left at 4am to get to the airport and the night manager came out oft her office to wish us a good trip and make sure we did not need anything else before we left.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel. The Villa laguna is located on the Lido in Venice and has amazing viers of st marks Square. The breakfast/ dining room faces the lagoon so mealtimes are an amazing experience. The location is great- 2 minutes from the waterbus stop. Buses take about 10 minutes and bus 1 will tae you right up the Grand canal- Great for sightseeing. Service at the hotel is great. On arrival we were shown to our room, talked through local amenities etc. Rooms are reasonably roomy for a city. The bed was 2 singles made up as a double so plently of room. The usual extras too- tv satelite mini bar, free safe etc. breakfast was traditionally european so if you are looking for a full english you'll be disapointed. overall a really warm and friendly hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful clean room and great views from the restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: BellaStook
Reviews.Content: The service from the front desk staff was excellent, providing a map and suggesting routes on the waterways and how to access these easily. The room was clean and quite large, although the bed wasn't the most comfortable thing I've ever slept on...but breakfast made up for this and was amazing, sitting in the sun bathed dining room looking out over the water. Villa Laguna was easy to find with a water bus stop only about 50-100m away and a short ride to the Grand canal, and was far enough away to feel like you were on a small island in the middle of the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “We would stay here again in a heartbeat.”
Reviews.Author: wanderingwendy
Reviews.Content: We had heard mixed reviews about even visiting Venice, so this place seemed like a great fit. Only a 10-15 minute boat ride from St. Marks where we could spend as much time as we wanted in the city, but we could also leave the crowds behind and not have to worry about noise or possible smells and there is a beach on this narrow island as well. Our room was on the water's edge with a grassy area that was ours and it had a great view of St. Mark's. The room was spacious with a bedroom and even had a kitchette. Breakfast was included and a free cruise to Murano Island on a beautiful boat was included to see glass blowing and tour/purchase amazing glass blown creations. Breakfast was a wonderful spread too. They also had a bar and restaurant there for the evenings. It was a boutique hotel and we liked the size and the service. We had two rooms since we are a family of six, but they were willing to accomodate us with our rooms across the hall from each other. Lots of restaurants on Lido, but we easily went into Venice proper for meals as desired. It is very close to the Vaporetto stop. Buy the 3 day pass for public transportation--you won't regret having the freedom to get on and off and have to keep buying tickets. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Laguna - a quiet respite from the tourist madness in Venice”
Reviews.Author: cmacginnis
Reviews.Content: We chose the Villa Laguna as we were looking for water views and a bit more value - very difficult in Venice! However, very happy with our choice. The Lido is the 'real' Venice, filled with Italians and not with hordes of tourists. Plus, it is only a short 10 minute vaporetto ride from Piazza San Marco and the vaporettos run very frequently, until quite late at night. The hotel itself is very traditionally decorated in Venitian style - not our tastes exactly, but it all added to the experience. We were in Room 2 I believe on the ground floor, with doors opening into our own private bit of grass right on the lagoon with a little table and chairs. The room itself has four very small rooms - a very small living space with couch and TV, a small bedroom, bathroom and kitchen area (which we didn't touch). I think they could probably make a better use of the space by knocking through the wall and having one big bedroom, but still nice. The bed wasn't the most comfortable (the usual two twin beds pushed together Euro-style affair) but passable. Hotel breakfast was ample with standard continental offerings - cereals, fruit, meats, cheeses, hard boiled eggs and breads. There seemed to be an outdoor area for drinks in the evening that wasn't open whilst we were there because the weather was pretty terrible (rain everyday). The Lido had a great selection of places to eat in the evenings, some very busy! Recommend the Roxy, which had a set menu offering that was very good and reasonably priced. After a couple days battling the tourists on the main island, we spent a day just exploring the Lido by bike, which is recommended. As it was May, the beaches were still closed but got to see the Hotel des Bains (under construction), Excelsior plus miles of lovely coastline before heading back to Gran Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta for some ice cream. Overall, I am really happy with our decision to stay at Villa Laguna and on the Lido. After a day amongst the crowds in Venice, it was a welcome calm and gave us some real insight into the local people and culture. Recommend having an appertivo drink with the locals at one the bars in the evening - the prosecco was lovely!

Reviews.Title: “Good and comfortable, great views!”
Reviews.Author: CJ70
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, but a great location on Lido. Stunning view of Venice. Staff was helpful and the rooms were comfortable although a bit too small! Breakfast options needs to be improved!

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this one!”
Reviews.Author: Swansbury
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant! Good value for money, away from the Venice crowds, but only 15min into Venice by water bus from the waterbus stop 50m away. Great views from our lagoon-facing suite and excellent service. Magda and Desiree looked after us very well, and all the staff were very friendly and helpful. My only suggestion would be for the restaurant to serve Italian/Venetian food at reasonable prices - with such views from the restaurant, offering pizza/pasta at sensible prices would fill the restaurant. Instead, most guests while we were there ate at the local restaurants and used the hotel facility for an (expensive) evening drink or two. So hotel brilliant, restaurant could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Laguna...fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: funsandybeach
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Villa Laguna from 6/6-6/9/10 was everything I expected and more. This is a charming property and we had a spacious suite for 4 people. We had an additional room for 2 other people in our group. Their room was on the bottom floor, while we were just one floor up. Would have preferred rooms next to each other, but as this is a small property is wasn't really an issue. Both rooms were very clean and kept clean throughout our stay. The living room portion of out suite had a small balcony outside with chairs and a pullout sofa where my 2 teenage boys slept. Also a small table and chairs and a large sofa type chair were in this room. There is a kitchenette also, if you ask for the key to open it up there is an additional charge. We did not use it. We loved the spacious accomodations and appreciated having separate sleeping rooms for the 4 of us in our suite. The room for 2 had it's own little private sitting area that faced the lagoon...very nice. There is an adequate breakfast spread...cereals, fruits, pastries, meats, cheese, etc. And the hotel serves dinner in their restaurant. We did eat there one night just for the convenience of it. It was a very good meal, but it a little pricey. They have a bar outside in the evenings, though we did not utilize it. The location is great...right on the lagoon and a very quick walk from the vaporetto. The vaporetto ran regularly, but it could take some time to get across to St. Marks Square...depending upon how many stops there were. We enjoyed the Lido very much as it was nice and quite, but we did spend some time getting back and forth from Venice. This would be the only drawback of staying here. That being said, I would stay here again, as it was a very nice property with friendly staff. We did purchase the 72 hour vaporetto pass, and this came in quite handy for the trips back and forth as well to go to Murano and Burano. Also to just hop on in Venice to get around when we were tired. My only negative comment about our rooms would be the TV's...we had 2 in oiur suite...we couldn't get one to work at all. And the other worked but didn't get many stations. I don't think the TV in our room for 2 worked. This wasn't really a problem, as we were not there to watch Italian TV...just turned it on while winding down in the evening. But we also had the same issue at our hotel in Rome later on this trip. Overall, we had a great stay and would recommend this property. Also...I had emailed the hotel a couple of times before our arrival with questions...both times received very prompt and friendly responses. This was comforting to me, knowing we were staying somewhere that apparently cared about their guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with the best view of Venice”
Reviews.Author: vaishyv
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as part of a suprise for my other half....and he loved it! The location was fantastic. Hotel was only a 2 minute walk away from the Lido water stop, and the beach 5-10 minutes away. Our double suite was spacious and from our room we could see San Marco skyline. As if this wasn't enough, the outdoor bar was the perfect place to enjoy a cocktail whilst watching the sunset over Venice....magic! Will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Scottish_lass59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 10 days and it was lovely, relaxing and the staff were very polite and helpful. Room was on the side of the hotel by the road but with window closed could hear nothing. Air condition was very effiecient (even had a fight with new husband as I was too cold and he was fine). Staff were helpful with booking taxis and got us a table for dinner even though we hadn't reserved. Breakfast had a good selection of fresh food and fruit. So glad we stayed on the Lido as couldn't have coped with the hustle of Venice constantly. Hotel is really well situated - easy for Venice, beach, shops and restaurants. Rooms were cleaned every day and towels replaced every second day (can be changed everyday but not needed). Even our cleaner was polite and friendly. Thoroughly enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel only 10 minutes away from the bustle of Venice”
Reviews.Author: ajtraveller007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Laguna in May 2010. It was very easy to reach from the Marco Polo airport. Follow the covered pathway to Alilaguna (just after the water taxis) and for 26 euros each, the boat will drop you at Lido, less than 200 meters from the hotel. (note: pay in cash for Alilaguna as its parent company is a casino so you you get hit with a cash advance if you pay with credit card). Turn right and you will see the beautiful red building. We stayed in the suite which was very large and had a kitchen which we didn't need. (it was extra for the kitchen if you used it) It had lovely rustic beams and a good size bathroom. We loved the character of the room. The only downside was that it was right over the vaparetto stop so it was a bit noisy with the boat engines but not enough that we wouldn't stay there again. The young lady on the desk was extremely cheerful and full of lots of good advice. The breakfast was lovely and the view of Venice and all the boat traffic was very entertaining to watch while eating. It was a very large breakfast and usually we didn't need lunch. Other reviews have mentioned how expensive the restaurant is, they offer a lovely welcome dinner for your first night for only 28 euros which is a real deal and the smoked fish was wonderful. The vaparetto stop is right there so it is easy to get to Venice, the train station, Murano as the vaparettos come by every few minutes. We got the 72 hour pass so didn't have to worry about getting tickets. The weather wasn't the best while we were there so we didn't go to Lido's beach but would like to come back to see it. There is a nice shopping area only steps away. Overall, this was our favourite place to stay in Italy and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fabulous location with very friendly and helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: mnuxvom
Reviews.Content: This has to be the jewel in the crown. Fantastic location, beautifully decorated with extremely friendly and helpful staff. This was my third trip to Venice, and my first stay on the Lido. We had a suite consisting of a double bedroom, a lounge with a very comfortable sofabed and of course a bathroom. There was a fridge and optional extra kitchenette facilities but we chose not to utilise the kitchenette. Breakfast is included in the price and was plentiful and good quality ( fresh rather than canned fruit and not cheap cereal for example). We used the restuarant for an evening meal for the first night and the food was very good and reasonably priced in comparison to other venues that we also sampled during our stay. Yes there are cheaper venues but the quality is not always comparative! It is conveniently situated right next to the water bus station and so getting into Venice and surrounding islands was easy. The hotel makes the most of its fabulous views of St Marks square directly opposite and is reached in approximately 10 mins. I would most definitely use this hotel again, we hopped on and off the water bus and visited both Venice and its islands having purchased a 3 day ticket which I would also recommend. These can be topped up if your stay is extended. Well done Hotel Villa Laguna.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel right on the water...”
Reviews.Author: rossub40
Reviews.Content: Got upgraded as soon as we arrived due to no lift working...it meant we got no view from the window but we were heardly in the room. A full sky tv service if you wanted it, a fridge which was handy (and minibar) and a seperate living area to your bedroom. Really plush bathtoom, small but great venecian style decor. Very helpful polite waitress and front desk staff. Didn't try the restaurant as far to pricy, but the breakfast was well presented and enough. Location is right next to the water bus stop which is 10 minutes to the beautiful centre of Venice. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and a great introduction for a first trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: BoratHi5
Reviews.Content: I looked at several hotels that would be close enough to Venice without being right in the centre near St Marks and this one ticked all of the boxes. A 12 minute boat ride away from the main shops and museums and on the direct service from the airport. The hotel is no more than 2 minutes walk from the boat so no worries about lugging suitcases up and down the bridges and cobbles in central Venice. We did notice some noise from the boats during the night but I challenge anyone to beat the view from the breakfast terrace. Bed wasn't the best but by all accounts that's quite typical in Italy. Staff were very good although they didn't seem to keen on people leaving breakfast too late. They say up till 10.30 but started to clear a bit earlier. Typical continental breakfast but plenty of choice and quality was fine. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurant for reasons other reviewers have mentioned. It's about 3 times more expensive than the wide range of local restaurants on your doorstep. One supermarket within 5 minutes of the hotel stocked soft drinks and everything you would need for snacks etc at really good prices but was always packed with long queues at most times of the day so sometimes, it's worth paying a bit more not to waste time doing what we can do back in the UK! Best advice for anyone going to stay on Lido is buy the 48 or 72 hour boat pass and make full use of it. We used to for trips to Murano, up and down the Grand Canal, to and from St Marks and certainly had our money's worth. Overall, for our first visit to Venice, this was a good choice of hotel and we would stay on this side of the water again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: charlieklosters
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 2 nights, but will certainly be back. Lido is a clean and peaceful haven just 10 min. from St. Marco. Our suite 317 had spectacular views over the lagoon and was spacious enough for all 5 of us, with a separate master bedroom. There is a well priced trendy clothes shop 3 min. away, which kept my girls happy. Next time I would use the provided kitchen (surcharge) and buy food from the well stocked supermarket, 3 min. away, to keep our food bill down. The breakfast in the hotel was plenty and very good. Overall a brilliant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, wonderful location, wonderful Lido”
Reviews.Author: Mills48
Reviews.Content: > We've visited Venice many times and know it well. We both travel regularly worldwide for work and have seen enough hotels to last a lifetime, great, good, average and awful. For both of us, the Villa Laguna is way up with the very best. We wouldn't stay anywhere else now. > > Venice can be a rather frantic place if you don't know your way around. So the Laguna enjoys the perfect location across the lagoon on the Lido which lies just to the south of Venice. It also enjoys one of the most fabulous views in the world across the Lagoon to St. Marks Square. > > We have stayed at the hotel several times over a number of years and with heavy hearts watched it decline in decor and standards. Now under new ownership and fully and superbly refurbished, we have fallen back in love with the lovely Laguna. Sitting in the breakfast/dining room looking across the Lagoon frantic with boats of all descriptions, St, Marks gleaming in the sunshine across the water, is our own small heaven. > > Because we often stay in large, hopelessly bland, boring hotels for work, the Laguna is a perfect size with around 20 rooms. For the best views across the Lagoon, ask for suites 317 or 318 on the third floor ( there is a lift). And another tip is always ask for rooms facing the Lagoon. > > For us, a long leisurely breakfast is one of life's simple pleasures and the breakfasts at the Laguna are splendid and sufficient, plus that stunning view! Staff throughout on our last visit were thoroughly helpful, courteous and kind. > > The Lido is really Venice's hidden gem and one of the reasons we love the area so much. Its ten minutes from Venice by waterbus but with its own entirely separate character. The architecture is still ravishing, the pace is calmer, the restaurants informal and inexpensive, the long beach on the southern side stylish and chic. Renting beach tents and recliners is expensive, but we join the locals by the sea-shore or the jetties in front of the private beaches. There is also a long stretch of public beach just beyond the Hotel Des Bains. And blissfully there are few English accents and no radios, as well as a real family atmosphere. > > Our advice to people visiting Venice is simple. By all means enjoy St. Marks Square, the Bridge of Sighs and the Rialto Bridge but then walk away from the milling throng of tourists. You can always be away from the crowds in a matter of moments and wander the by-ways and canal-sides for hours. We still get lost but that is part of the fun. > > As well as its perfect location, the Laguna stands close to the waterbus stops to Venice and all the surrounding islands. The No 1 vaporetto ( waterbus) from the Lido across the Lagoon and down the Grand Canal is simply the best journey in the world.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Laguna
HotelInfo.Address: Via Sandro Gallo, 6, 30126 Venice, Italy
